fleetmanagementsystem.gui.fleetapp module

class fleetmanagementsystem.gui.fleetapp.FleetApp(root: Tk)[source]

Bases: object

Fleet Management System application.

This class handles the main GUI components, user interactions, and integrates with the VehicleManager and FilterManager for backend operations.

apply_filters() → None[source]

Apply the selected filters and update the vehicle list.

bulk_delete() → None[source]

Delete selected vehicles from the database and refresh the vehicle list.

clear_filters() → None[source]

Clear all filters and reset the vehicle list.

create_widgets() → None[source]

Create and layout the widgets for the application.

edit_vehicle_popup(event: Event) → None[source]

Open a popup window for editing an existing vehicle.

Parameters:

event (tk.Event) – The event object containing information about the click event.

list_all_vehicles() → None[source]

Fetch and display all vehicles.

open_add_vehicle_popup() → None[source]

Open a popup window for adding a new vehicle.

toggle_checkbox(event: Event) → None[source]

Toggles the checkbox state (checked/unchecked) for the clicked row in the Treeview.

Parameters:

event (tk.Event) – The event object containing information about the click event.

update_treeview(records: List[List[Any]]) → None[source]

Update the treeview with given records.

Parameters:

records (List[List[Any]]) – The records to display in the treeview.

vehicle_popup(mode: str, vehicle_data: List[Any] | None = None) → None[source]

Open a popup window for adding or editing a vehicle.

Parameters:

  • mode (str) – The mode of the popup (“add” or “edit”).

  • vehicle_data (Optional[List[Any]]) – Data for the vehicle to edit.

A subclass of FilterManager that integrates with Tkinter-specific components.

Reset all filters to their default values, including CustomDatePicker widgets.

fleetmanagementsystem.gui.vehiclepopup module

class fleetmanagementsystem.gui.vehiclepopup.VehiclePopup(root: Any, manager: VehicleManager, list_all_vehicles: Callable[[], None], mode: Literal['add', 'edit'], vehicle_data: Dict[str, Any] | None = None)[source]

Bases: object

Popup window for adding or editing a vehicle.

create_widgets() → None[source]

Create and layout the widgets in the popup window.

delete_vehicle() → None[source]

Delete the current vehicle from the database.

Displays appropriate success or error messages based on the outcome.

save_changes() → None[source]

Save the changes made to the vehicle.

This method validates the input data and either adds a new vehicle or updates an existing one in the database. It shows appropriate messages based on the success or failure of the operation.
